required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Leptin Replacement in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Leptin Replacement in Children

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the endocrine and immune effects of leptin replacement in leptin-deficient children, from a consanguineous family. The hypothesis is that leptin replacement will have significant effects on endocrine function.

detailed_description.textblock: The proposed study of the treatment of a child with congenital leptin deficiency will permit to elucidate key aspects of human endocrine function, and will give new insights on the role of leptin in human endocrine regulation.

arm_group.description: Recombinant methionyl human leptin: Recombinant methionyl human leptin, subcutaneous, once a day, 0.02 to 0.04 mg/kg (adjusted according to weight loss).

intervention.description: Recombinant methionyl human leptin, subcutaneous, once a day, 0.02 to 0.04 mg/kg (adjusted according to weight loss), indeterminate duration.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children with a functional leptin gene mutation from a consanguineous Turkish family. Only one leptin-na√Øve child from this family is alive and eligible.
Exclusion Criteria:
- N/A

facility.name: University of Miami, Center on Pharmacogenomics

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This is a compassionate use study for a rare disease population. To protect participant privacy and maintain confidentiality, results will not be reported.
